author: InkPrincess
title: A Very Common Boio
review:
If you search Ninjago Kendo Pod on eBay, Zane is the first one you'll find, and you'll find him the most. He was the first one I ordered and I was very ecstatic to get him in the mail since he's one of my favorites from the series. 

It didn't take long to build him, but the pieces can easily get lost. He's a one-sided head mini-fig, with his little quiver on his back and the shurikens and bow at the ready. The pegs for Zane to stand on in the pod hold him in place, and he'd only come loose if I accidentally drop the pod for some reason.

I only have two real issues with this pod: 
One is the fact that it's white. Duh, what else would you expect, he's the White Ninja, but I like keeping my Legos and my Mini-Figures clean. I can't just wash the pod with detergent or in the dishwasher on sanitize like I normally do every few months (a lot of colds come through my house) because the background sticker can get ruined, and that's something I'd like to avoid.

My only other issue is the fact that the training helmet on the mannequin won't stay on. It comes loose if you bounce it around in your bag enough. The same goes for the other pods, but I guess the fact that the mannequin takes up the majority of the space and it won't fall off the head makes up for it.
